message: Yeah, too bad they were sold out so soon. There's a debate going on that the capacity must be increased. But again the concern is that could turn out into another large scale event with no personal touch. What do you think of that?
The aim of the WWDC is to get in touch with Apple engineers to learn how to develop the best apps possible. I think it's better with not too much people.

I agree with @benjipetit and what you said @damcruise. If you increase the capacity, you risk WWDC turning into SXSW, where there is hardly any personal feel anymore. It's extremely important that Mac and iOS devs can use this opportunity to talk with real Apple engineers because in reality it is the only time they can do so.
WWDC is almost like a concert now, like lets get tickets and see Steve Jobs
